problem.title: Blocks and Pulleys

img.alt: Two Boxes Connected by Rope on Incline

problem.parameter:
Consider two blocks connected by an ideal rope that passes through an ideal pulley fixed on the corner of the wedge as shown in the figure. The blocks have masses \(m_1\) and \(m_2\). The block of mass \(m_1\) is on the incline surface (which is frictionless) while the block of mass \(m_2\) hangs up in the air. Find the angle \(\theta\) at which the two blocks are in equilibrium (i.e., not moving).
\(\theta= \sin^{-1} (\frac{m_2}{m_1})\)
\(\theta= \cos^{-1} (\frac{m_2}{m_1})\)
\(\theta= \sin^{-1} (\frac{m_1+m_2}{m_1})\)
\(\theta= \sin^{-1} (\frac{m_1}{m_1+m_2})\)
\(\theta= \cos^{-1} (\frac{m_1}{m_1+m_2})\)
